{{Infobox musical artist |name = Sajjad Ali
'''Ø³Ø¬Ø§Ø¯Ø¹ÙÛ''' |image = sajjadalisnap.jpg |background = solo_singer |birth_name = Sajjad Ali |Citizenship = {{flagicon|Pakistan}} Pakistani |alias = Sajjad Bhai, Gagi bhai |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1966|8|24|df=yes}} |death_date = |origin = [[Karachi]], [[Pakistan]] |instrument = [[Vocals]] |genre = [[Pop music|Pop]]
[[Rock music|Rock]]
[[Classical music|Classical]] |occupation = [[Singer-songwriter]]
[[Musician]] |years_active = 1979âpresent | label = [[EMI]]-Pakistan, Sound Master |associated_acts = Lucky Ali [[Waqar Ali]] | website = | Spouse = Noreen Sajjad }} '''Sajjad Ali''' ({{lang-ur|'''Ø³Ø¬Ø§Ø¯ Ø¹ÙÛ'''}}; born 24 August 1966 in [[Karachi]]) is a [[Pakistan]]i [[semi-classical music|semi-classical]], [[pop music|pop]] [[singer]], [[film actor]], [[film director|director]] and [[film producer|producer]]. He is trained in [[Indian classical music|classical singing]].[http://pakheaven.com/music/paki-pop Sajjad Ali] == Early life and education == His father, Shafqat Hussain (Sajan), was a Pakistani film actor and also a cricketer.[http://vidpk.com/28281/Sajjad-Ali-in-Brunch-w-Bushra-P-14/ Sajjad Ali in Brunch with Bushra (Video)] Before Sajjad was born, he appeared for the first time in a film, ''Badal Aur Bijli'' in 1973. Sajjad did his F.A from National Art's College, because of which, his father, Hussain started teaching music to him with his classical collections. During Sajjad's training, Hussain played music from classical artists such as [[Ustad Bade Ghulam Ali Khan]], Ustaad Barkat Ali Khan and Ustad Mubarak Ali Khan. == Career == ===Music=== Sajjad's first classical hit album, '[[Master Sajjad Sings Memorable Classics]]' was released in 1979 by [[EMI]]-[[Pakistan]]. The musicians were [[Bade Ghulam Ali Khan]], [[Mehdi Hassan]], [[Ghulam Ali]] and [[Amanat Ali Khan]], while most of the songs were written by [[Hasrat Mohani]], [[Momin]] and others. Sajjad made his television debut in a program, ''Aap Janab'' by Athar Shah Khan. After this, he appeared in ''Rung Barangi Duniya'' by musician [[Sohail Rana]]. He also performed in a program ''Rag Rung'' in 1980 at the age of 14, however on the 25th anniversary of [[Pakistan Television|PTV]]'s stage show, called Silver Jubilee by [[Shoaib Mansoor]], Sajjad got real fame through the song, ''Banwari Chakori'', originally sung by [[Noor Jehan]]. On November 26, 1983, during a show, Sajjad sung the songs, ''[[Sajjad Ali 1980 singles|Lagi Ray Lagay Lagan Yehe Dil Mein]]'' and ''[[Sajjad Ali 1980 singles|Bawari Chakuri]]''. He produced ''[[Babia 93]]'', ''[[Chief Saab]]'' and ''[[Sohni Lag Di]]''. [[Image:Sajjadali at paiman.jpg|thumb|left|Sajjad Ali performs at the launch of a U.S. sponsored music video to promote health awareness about mothers and newborns.]] His brother [[Waqar Ali]] is also in the music industry. Sajjad along with his brother, wrote lyrics for most of the songs in his albums, while lyricists, Sabir Zafar, Mohammad Nasir, Nadeem Asad, and Ali Moin have also wrote some songs. In July 2006, Sajjad released a single called ''Chal Rein De'', a more classical song.[http://music.love2pak.com/user/admin/?q=ply&sid=44&snam=Chal%20Rein%20De&tg=low&anam=&aid=0 Sajjad ali album Chal Rein De] On 3 September 2006, he released another single in a totally different genre with the help of Meloscience Corp.[http://www.last.fm/music/Meloscience+Corp. Meloscience Corp.] The song is known as ''Sajjad-Ali Sinsym Flight'', and it is an experimental, jazzy, Sufi beat. In late April 2008, Sajjad released his album, ''[[Chahar Balish]]'', which contained new tracks as well as some previous tracks such as ''Chal Rein De''. On 25 March 2010, Sajjad joined U.S. to promote "Life".[http://islamabad.usembassy.gov/pr-10032605.html Islamabad US Embassy] He performed at the launch of a new music video produced by the Pakistan Initiative for Mothers and Newborns (PAIMAN), a U.S. assistance program. Two new compositions of Sajjad Ali from the film ''[[Bol (film)|Bol]]'' by [[Shoaib Mansoor]] were released by [[Tips Industries|Tips]] music on 22 May 2011 in [[India]] and on 30 May 2011 by [[Fire Records (Pakistan)|Fire Records]] in [[Pakistan]].[http://www.facebook.com/bolfilm/posts/185897711459686 BOL THE MOVIE] He is also appearing in the second episode of ''[[Coke Studio]]'' with his song "Kir Kir", which will be broadcast on the major television channels across Pakistan on 5 June 2011.[http://www.facebook.com/cokestudio/posts/226095187402734 Coke Studio] === Films and television === Sajjad directed his first telefilm, ''[[Love Letter (Sajjad Ali album)|Love Letter]]'' in 1989, and then his first full length motion picture, ''[[Aik Aur Love Story]]'' in 1998.[http://www.pakmdb.com/movies.php?lang=U&q=sajjad+ali&Submit=Submit Pak Movie Database] Before that, he also performed as an actor and a singer in a film, ''Munda Tera Deewana'' which was directed by Zahoor Husain Gillani. Sajjad has also sang songs for drama serials, ''[[Teri Yaad]]'' in drama serial ''Thori Khushi Thora Ghum'' (which was onair on ''[[Pakistan Television Corporation|PTV]]''), ''[[Rangeen|Na Boloon Gi]]'' in ''Na Tum Jano Na Hum Janain'' (''[[ARY Digital]]'') and ''[[Sajjad Ali 1980 singles|Sunn Leyna]]'' in ''Sunn Leyna'' ( ''[[ARY Digital]]'' ).[http://ary.com ARY DIGITAL] His brother, [[Waqar Ali]] also helped him during the making of these songs as he is credited too.[http://www.themuzik.com/pakistani-songs/waqar-ali/173.htm Waqar Ali] Sajjad is appearing with his new songs in [[Shoaib Mansoor]]'s upcoming film ''[[Bol (film)|Bol]]'' which is releasing on June 24, 2011 as announced on the official website. Sajjad has confirmed that this song have been recorded in his own studio in Dubai and by the name of Din Pareshan hai, having two versions, according to sajjad ali this song is different from the song in his album Chahar Balish which has also the same title.[http://www.facebook.com/bolfilm BOL The Movie] === Critical acclaim === Musician, [[A.R. Rahman]] has described Sajjad as the original crossover. : "From the realm of the classical, he metamorphosed into one of the brightest lights of Pakistani pop.Always striking the right note, and never missing a beat, even the most hardened purist has to give Sajjad his due. This man can breathe life in a [[Ghazal]] even as he puts the V back into verve. He is one of the very few singers in Pakistan who seems a complete singer. As far as skill is concerned I feel nobody compares to Sajjad Ali. He is simply too good at everything he chooses to create."[http://www.arrahman.com/ A.R. Rahman official website] {{WebCite|url=http://www.webcitation.org/5jWBDi8qH|date =2009-09-03}} [[Hans Raj Hans]] had said:"If I were to be born again, I'd like to be born as Sajjad Ali"[http://www.india-forums.com/forum_posts.asp?TID=60105 Interview by Mag4You.com] == Personal life == Sajjad married his first cousin in 1989. Sajjad has four children from Noreen, two sons and two daughters.[http://vidpk.com/28290/Sajjad-Ali-in-Brunch-w-Bushra-P-34 Sajjad Ali in Brunch with Bushra] Nowadays, he is settled in [[Ajman]], United Arab Emirates with his family. == Discography == === Albums === {|class="wikitable" style="width:98%; font-size:90%; background=#ffffff;" |- !
